title: US strikes in Syria mark start of 'sustainable, persistent campaign' â as it happened | World news | The Guardian
summary: erdoäan supports us-led strikes in syria .
strikes in syria : summary of reports of civilian casualties .
us official : 200 strikes on a dozen targets .
cameron : 'this is not a fight we can opt out of '
president notifies congress of 'systematic campaign of airstrikes '

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : the united states announced the beginning of a sustainable , persistent ' military campaign in syria and iraq .
the fight against isis militants would take years , the pentagon said .
air strikes by the us late monday targeted an al-qaeda group referred to as khorasan .
those were us-only strikes against the khorasan group , the pentagon said .
two subsequent waves of strikes targeted isis militants , the pentagon said .
us allies carried out a small number of the strikes .
saudi arabia published of its pilots who had participated in the mission .
five other regional states were said to have participated .
the united states warned syria , iran , and israel about the air strikes beforehand , various officials said .
the us said it had not coordinated with syria .
israel shot down a syrian jet that was in its air space for 80 seconds .
syria condemned the act .
the jet was said to be on a mission against syrian rebels .
local reports indicated civilian casualties from us strikes in the northeastern town of kfar dariyan , but the pentagon said it was unaware of any civilian casualties .
at least 120 militants were reported killed in the strikes .
president barack obama said the strikes were needed to disrupt plotting against the united states .
the pentagon said khorasan was nearing the execution phase in an attack either in northern europe , or the homeland .
world leaders were meeting at a united nations summit in new york .
support for the attacks was audible except from russia , which condemned them as a violation of syrian sovereignty .
read the previous summary here .

an anonymous official on the iranian side quoted by reuters agrees with the earlier ap report quoting a us official as saying that the united states told iran beforehand about its plan to strike in syria .

reuters : the united states informed iran in advance of its intention to strike islamic state militants in syria and told tehran that it would not target the forces of syrian president bashar al-assad , a senior iranian official told reuters .

iran was concerned about assad 's position and his government being weakened in case of any action against is ( islamic state ) insyria and brought this issue up in meetings with americans , a senior iranian official said on condition of anonymity .

this issue was first discussed in geneva and then was discussed thoroughly in new york where iran was assured that assad and his government will not be targeted in case of any military action against daesh ( islamic state ) in syria .
he added that iran was informed separately in advance of the airstrike .
the iranian president has been photographed at the united nations with the french president and rouhani is scheduled to meet with the british prime minister .
so far reza marashi ( @ rezamarashi ) cameron ?
check .
hollande ?
check .
obama ?
# rouhani # unga # iran

this would expand the coalition as currently described : ahmed al omran ( @ ahmed ) kuwait provided funding the airstrikes on isis , according to anonymous jordanian official ( via @ twitterid ) the official said funding for the strikes was provided jointly by the uae , kuwait , saudi arabia and qatar .
the strikes have targeted mainly islamist extremist groups in syria as well as the islamic state , he said .
richard engel is under secretary of state for public diplomacy and public affairs : rick stengel ( @ stengel ) .
@ johnkerry on anti-isil bombing in iraq & syria in concert with arab allies : isil can not have a safe haven for their grotesque atrocities .

syria knew in advance , israel knew in advance and now iran knew in advance , too , the ap reports : matt lee ( @ apdiplowriter ) `` we communicated our ( # syria airstrike ) intentions , but not specific timing or targets , to the iranians , '' senior us official says .
# iran

here 's a said to be of one of those saudi sorties : ahmed al omran ( @ ahmed ) saudi pilots returned safely to their base after carrying out airstrikes against isis in syria : state news agency susris ( @ saudius ) @ lrozen @ twitterid they were used in cross border action against houthis .
aljazeera had video of strikes .

documents.title: erdoäan supports us-led strikes in syria
text: in a statement at the un tuesday , turkish president recep tayyip erdoäan promised support for the us strikes in syria , reuters reports : we will give the necessary support to the operation .
the support could be military or logistics , erdoäan was quoted by turkish broadcaster ntv as telling reporters in new york .
he also welcomed air strikes on isil targets in iraq and syria , saying that the strikes should continue uninterruptedly .
mohamed hemish ( @ mohamedhemish ) big shift- # erdogan on anti-is airstrikes : # turkey will give necessary support 4 operation against is .

support cld be military or political '' ( h/t : @ twitterid ) background from the reuters report : nato ally turkey , which is alarmed by islamic state but also worried about kurdish fighters and opposed to any action that might help syrian president bashar al assad , had so far refused a military role in the coalition .
turkey is home to a major u.s. base in the southern town of incirlik , which officials have said has not been used so far in any lethal strikes in iraq or syria .
erdogan said turkey viewed the u.s.-led action positively and said it should continue .

turkish officials has said its hands were tied while 46 of its citizens were held hostage by islamic state militants in northern iraq , including its consul general in mosul , soldiers and diplomats ' children .
the coalition : josh lederman ( @ joshledermanap ) obama meets with new iraqi pm , leaders from 5 arab nations helping with syria air strikes

documents.title: alan henning family issues message
text: the family of alan henning , the british aid volunteer kidnapped in 2012 and believed now to be held by isis , have issued the following message to his captors : i am barbara henning the wife of alan henning .
i have a further message for islamic state .
an audio file of alan pleading for his life has just been received by me .
i and people representing me continue to reach out to those holding alan .
islamic state continue to ignore our pleas to open dialogue .
i have seen muslims across the globe question islamic state over alan 's fate .
the voices of the people have spoken out loud and clear .
he was working with muslims to help the most vulnerable within syria .
nothing has changed .
he went to syria to help his muslim friends deliver much needed aid .
we are at a loss why those leading islamic state can not open their hearts and minds to the facts surrounding alan 's imprisonment and why they continue to threaten his life .
i have been told that he has been to a sharia court and found innocent of being a spy and declared to be no threat .
i implore islamic state to abide by the decisions of their own justice system .
please release alan .

earlier tuesday , the brother-in-law of alan henning spoke of his fears over us air strikes in syria aimed at the militants ' strongholds , the guardian 's chris johnston reported : colin livesey said on tuesday he was concerned that the action could prompt isis to move henning and make his whereabouts unknown once more .
i do n't want to lose the faith in knowing he 's coming home , he told itv news .

the pentagon insists that its military focus remains on iraq even as it expands operations to syria , guardian us national security editor spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) reports : what you saw today and what you saw last night were a disruption to isil forces that were enabling their strikes into iraq , mayville said , using another name for isis .

we are focused first in iraq because we have a partner in iraq to work with , the iraqi security forces , the iraqi government , but we are striking through the depths of isil 's formations , because we are trying to disrupt their support bases .

echoing comments from his boss , gen martin dempsey , the chairman of the joint chiefs of staff , mayville said he would think of the credible and sustainable persistent campaign against isis in terms of years .

[ ] us officials were cautious that isis was a resilient enemy that is likely to adapt to us air attacks , something mayville said was already on display in iraq , the site of nearly 200 air strikes since 7 august .

yet despite forecasting a military campaign lasting years , there is no official designation for it , leaving confusion as to what to call the third major us war in iraq in 23 years a conflict that has emerged in defiance of obama 's central 2008 vow to end the last one .
our operations against isil have not been named , kirby said .
read the full report here .

as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : president barack obama officially notified congress of a systematic campaign of airstrikes the administration plans to carry out in syria and iraq .
it is not possible to know the duration of these deployments and operations , the president 's letter said .
the administration claims legal authority to conduct the strikes under the post-9/11 authorization to use military force .
( further reading . )
pentagon officials have now described the strikes inside syria in some detail .
an unnamed us official told ap there were about 200 strikes total .
local reports indicated civilian casualties from us strikes in the northeastern town of kfar dariyan , but the pentagon said it was unaware of any civilian casualties .
at least 120 militants were reported killed in the strikes .
president barack obama said the strikes were needed to disrupt plotting against the united states .
the pentagon said khorasan was nearing the execution phase in an attack either in northern europe , or the homeland .
of the five coalition partners the united states has named , three bahrain , jordan and saudi arabia have acknowledged a role .
qatar and the uae have not sought attention for their reported role .
the administration argues the strikes are justified under article 51 of the u.n. charter , which covers the individual or collective right of states to self-defense against armed attack .
world leaders are meeting at united nations headquarters in new york , where attendees include the iranian president , who was photographed meeting with his french counterpart .
read the previous summary here .

jenan moussa of al-aan tv flags a jabhat al-nusra / khorasan release of a photo of the kfar dariyan strike : jenan moussa ( @ jenanmoussa ) pic of nusra front headquarters in idlib # syria hit by u.s planes .
pic released by the group itself .
@ twitterid

not listed as members of the us coalition against isis : saeed kamali dehghan ( @ saeedkd ) iran 's president @ twitterid meets france 's franã§ois hollande in ny on the sidelines of the un general assembly :
the guardian 's martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) has filed a new story on how the civilians of raqqa experienced the air strikes there .

at first , i thought it was an air strike by assad , one says : the first strikes landed just after 2am , directed at sites that islamic state ( isis ) has openly used and that had long been flagged as targets .
the jihadis were no longer there though , having blended in with raqqa 's civilian population , where they knew they would be safer .
by daybreak , the governorate building , an isis command post for the past 15 months , a tv station and a syrian military base had been destroyed .
according to several residents who spoke to the guardian , up to 30 people were killed .
most , if not all , were militants .
the rest of the city remained hunkered down until the roaring jets and whining drones above had long gone .
at first , i thought it was an air strike by assad , said local resident mohammed sheiko .
but it was different this time .
it lasted for 30 minutes and the sound of bombing was louder than usual .
i saw smoke coming out of the governorate building and from the al-rasheed gardens .
i called a couple of my friends and they did n't know about any civilians killed , but they heard some isis fighters were killed , around 30 to 35 fighters .
i do n't fear the air strikes .
i hope they will bring us some good and not attack civilians .
read the full piece here .
the leader of hezbollah , the lebanese group fighting with president bashar assad in syria , has announced that the group opposes us-led air strikes on syria .

the comments echoed concerns voiced by the assad government before the strikes concerns seemingly belied by the communication between washington and damascus about the strikes and the passive posture of syrian air defences during the raids .

we are against american military intervention and an international coalition in syria , whether that ( action ) is against the regime or is , hezbollah leader sayyed hassan nasrallah said in a speech aired on hezbollah-run al-manar television , reuters reported .

documents.title: strikes in syria : summary of reports of civilian casualties
text: the guardian 's raya jalabi ( @ rayajalabi ) has been tracking down reports on civilian casualties from air strikes in the town of kfar dariyan in idlib province .
the pentagon said the strikes targeted khorasan militants and were carried out by the united states alone , without the participation of coalition partners .
the pentagon has said it is unaware of any civilian casualties from the strikes .
but on tuesday , raya writes , several social media posts and videos emerged from the ground in syria claiming to show civilian deaths following the us-led overnight air strikes .
( the site bellingcat has collected several of the posts here .
warning : graphic content . )

the syrian observatory for human rights a britain-based watchdog that has consistently charted military activity throughout syria 's war claimed that at least eight civilians had been killed , of which three were children .
a facebook group for the town of kfar dariyan in idlib province posted several updates on civilian casualties that supported the sohr 's initial claims .
a post from about seven hours ago listed the names of four dead : three children and the mother of one of the deceased children .
the same post listed 8 wounded , and referenced three women and three children who had been killed but not yet identified .
several hours later , a further post on the same facebook group gave the names of four more dead , all in the same family .
raya notes that during a 45-minute briefing by senior us officials for the media on tuesday , no mention was made of possible civilian casualties and no reporters asked .

it 's also of note that neither the white house nor the pentagon has confirmed whether attacks took place in kfar dariyan , preferring a vague reference to attacks west of aleppo , as can be seen in the map below , distributed by the defense department : a map of strikes in syria starting late monday as presented at a pentagon briefing tuesday , 23 september 2014 .
department of defense
pentagon spokesman read adm. john kirby has spoken about the role of coalition partners in a briefing on dod news , the pentagon broadcaster .
not all of them conducted strikes , kirby says .
most of them did .
kirby went on to say that the strikes on khorasan targets in northern and eastern syria were carried out only by the united states : those were us-only strikes against the khorasan group .
we certainly believe that we hit what we were aiming at .

documents.title: us official : 200 strikes on a dozen targets
text: a u.s. official says america and its arab allies launched more than 200 airstrikes against roughly a dozen militant targets in syria during the assault that began monday night , ap reports : the military mission was the beginning of a broad international campaign against islamic state militant strongholds in syria .
the u.s. simultaneously targeted the khorasan group , an al-qaida cell , west of the syrian city of aleppo that was said to be plotting imminent attacks on american and western interests .
the total number of strikes and targets had not been released .
the official says a majority of the 47 tomahawk missiles fired off u.s. navy ships in the persian gulf and red sea targeted eight khorasan sites .
the official spoke on condition of anonymity because the official was not authorized to provide mission details on the record by name .

note : these numbers from an unnamed official do n't seem to square with the pentagon 's briefing on the strikes there are more than a dozen strike sites plotted on the map presented at the pentagon earlier .
in case you missed it , dexter filkins on a crossroads for the kurds : martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) the fight of their lives .
a long , rich & essential dexter filkins piece on what now for the # kurds
lt. gen. william c. mayville jr. , speaks about airstrikes in syria during a briefing at the pentagon september 23 , 2014 in washington , dc .
mayville briefed the press about us and arab nation joint airstrikes against islamic state group targets in syria and unilateral airstrikes against an al-qaeda group in syria .
smialowski/afp/getty images a young syrian kurdish refugee enters turkey at the yumurtalik crossing gate on september 23 , 2014 in turkey .
as many as 138,000 syrian kurds have poured into turkey since september 19 fleeing the islamic state ( is ) group offensive in northeastern syria , according to the unhcr .
/getty images

meanwhile , in a new york courtroom , osama bin laden 's son-in-law has been sentenced tuesday to life in prison for acting as the voice of al-qaida after the sept. 11 terror attacks , the ap reports : sulaiman abu ghaith the highest-ranking al-qaida figure to face trial on u.s. soil since the attacks quoted from the quran , praised allah and suggested his case would prompt a backlash in the muslim world .

[ ] abu ghaith , 48 , was convicted in march on conspiracy charges that he answered osama bin laden 's request in the hours after the 2001 attacks to speak on the widely circulated videos used to recruit new followers willing to go on suicide missions like the 19 who hijacked four commercial jets on sept. 11 .
read the full piece here .
the pentagon today said coalition partners had participated in combat air patrols and actual strikes on targets , although the vast majority of strikes were american .

saudi arabia has now confirmed that its air force participated in us-led bombing in syria , reuters reports , citing a report in the official saudi press agency : an official source revealed that saudi air forces took part in military operations in syria against the islamic state group , and to support the moderate syrian opposition , within an international coalition , to combat terrorism , and to support the fraternal syrian people in returning security , unity and development to this devastated country , spa said .

saudi arabia , a u.s. ally , the world 's top oil exporter and birthplace of islam , has funnelled cash and arms to rebels fighting syrian president bashar al-assad but has also said it opposes islamist militants within the anti-assad insurgency .
spa gave no details about the saudi role in the air strikes .
read the full piece here .
martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) saudi arabia publicly confirmed its jets joined attack against # isis big moment for country used to acting via proxies # us

the united nations secretary-general has welcomed airstrikes against militants in syria which he says pose an immediate threat to international peace and security , ap reports : in opening remarks at a climate summit press conference tuesday , ban ki-moon urged world leaders gathered in new york to come together decisively in support of efforts to confront extremist groups .

relatedly , the united states has informed the united nations in a letter that it struck in syria because damascus has shown it can not and will not confront these safe havens , reuters reports : in the letter to u.n. secretary-general ban ki-moon , u.s .
ambassador to the united nations samantha power said the strikes were necessary to eliminate the islamic state threat to iraq , the united states and its allies .
she said the action was justified under article 51 of the u.n. charter , which covers the individual or collective right of states to self-defense against armed attack .

raf tornado jets based in cyprus are preparing to bomb isis targets in iraq and would be ready to strike soon after david cameron gives the green light , defence sources have said , reports the guardian 's richard norton-taylor ( @ taylornorton ) : six tornado gr4 aircraft , accompanied by a voyager refuelling tanker have been flying reconnaissance missions over northern iraq since they were deployed to the base at akrotiri a month ago .
the aircraft could be fitted with paveway iv guided bombs or brimstone missiles suitable for carrying out strikes on small targets such as isis vehicles .
an raf rivet joint surveillance plane equipped with listening devices has also been flying missions from al-udeid air base in qatar to eavesdrop on isis communications .
read the full piece here .

guardian washington correspondent paul lewis flags one question that did not come up in a conference call with senior administration officials about the strikes in syria : paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) white house just held a 45-minute call with reporters on military action in syria .
not a single question about civilian casualties .
video from the president 's statement earlier .
a transcript is here .

obama hails arab allies and says isis offensive is not america 's fight alone ' the latest guardian news story on this latest war as our national security editor spencer ackerman calls it , for want of a name is here .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) quite a comment on fate of afghanistan war & pakistan drone strikes that `` khorasan '' was able to exfiltrate operatives from there to syria .

the us notified israel in advance of the strikes , haaretz reports : barak ravid ( @ barakravid ) breaking : u.s. updated israel prior to strike against isil targets in syria , officials say ; full story coming up on the of how much warning syria had of the strikes and how syria may have participated even passively is still emerging .

syria has now said that us secretary of state john kerry had told the damascus government in a letter delivered by iraq that the united states and its allies were going to attack islamic state in syria , hours before the air strikes took place , reuters reports .
in his pentagon briefing earlier , lieutenant general william mayville declined to say whether syria turned its radar off to allow us planes entry and the assurance of a free hand .
the target acquisition radar acquisition i would characterize as passive , mayville said .
by isil airstrikes the pentagon means airstrikes against isil .
also obviously this is not live footage : u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) live footage of # isil airstrikes in # syria

the fight against islamist extremists is the new battle of britain , british secretary of state for defense michael fallon tells the spectator : he does n't accept this is some side effect of the previous intervention ' , dismissing the whole idea that this is blowback from the iraq war with a wave of the hand .
he has equally little time for the idea that britain should stay out of the fight .

he seems morally offended at the suggestion that we should leave it to other countries to deal with islamic state and irritated at the failure of some to grasp that the struggle against islamist extremism is britain 's business . '

we 've had attacks on the streets of london , on our transport system , at glasgow airport , the murder of lee rigby how much more evidence do you need that this is a very clear and dangerous threat to our way of life and to all the democracies of the west .
this is a new battle of britain . '
read the full piece here ( and thanks to @ twitterid for flagging ) .

documents.title: president notifies congress of 'systematic campaign of airstrikes '
text: the white house has circulated the text of a letter from obama to john boehner , the speaker of the house of representatives , and senator patrick leahy , the president pro tempore of the senate , consistent with the war powers resolution , regarding iraq .

here 's the full text of the letter , which does not mention khorasan : dear mr. speaker : ( dear mr. president : ) in my reports of august 8 and 17 and september 1 and 8 , 2014 , i described a series of discrete military operations in iraq to stop the advance on erbil by the islamic state of iraq and the levant ( isil ) , support civilians trapped on mount sinjar , support operations by iraqi forces to recapture the mosul dam , support an operation to deliver humanitarian assistance to civilians in the town of amirli , iraq , and conduct airstrikes in the vicinity of haditha dam .

as i noted in my address to the nation on september 10 , with a new iraqi government in place , and following consultations with allies abroad and the congress at home , i have ordered implementation of a new comprehensive and sustained counterterrorism strategy to degrade , and ultimately defeat , isil .

as part of this strategy , i have directed the deployment of 475 additional u.s. armed forces personnel to iraq , and i have determined that it is necessary and appropriate to use the u.s. armed forces to conduct coordination with iraqi forces and to provide training , communications support , intelligence support , and other support , to select elements of the iraqi security forces , including kurdish peshmerga forces .
i have also ordered the u.s. armed forces to conduct a systematic campaign of airstrikes and other necessary actions against these terrorists in iraq and syria .
these actions are being undertaken in coordination with and at the request of the government of iraq and in conjunction with coalition partners .
it is not possible to know the duration of these deployments and operations .
i will continue to direct such additional measures as necessary to protect and secure u.s. citizens and our interests against the threat posed by isil .

i have directed these actions , which are in the national security and foreign policy interests of the united states , pursuant to my constitutional and statutory authority as commander in chief ( including the authority to carry out public law 107-40 and public law 107-243 ) and as chief executive , as well as my constitutional and statutory authority to conduct the foreign relations of the united states .
i am providing this report as part of my efforts to keep the congress fully informed , consistent with the war powers resolution ( public law 93-148 ) .
i appreciate the support of the congress in this action .
sincerely , barack obama
as our live blog coverage continues , here 's a summary of where things stand : significant new details emerged of the us strikes tuesday inside syria .
the strikes happened in three waves , the pentagon said , with the first targeting the al-qaeda group khorasan and the next two targeting isis militants .
the air strikes will continue for days at least , the us indicated .
i can tell you that last night 's strikes were only the beginning , the pentagon said .
president barack obama said the strikes were needed to disrupt plotting against the united states .
the pentagon said khorasan was nearing the execution phase in an attack either in northern europe , or the homeland .
read more about khorasan here .
strikes against isis militants were carried out to create some space for the iraqi security forces to reorganize , the pentagon said .
obama said saudi arabia , bahrain , qatar , jordan and the uae had joined the offensive .
america is proud to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with these nations on behalf of our common security , obama said .
read a transcript of obama 's statement here .
british prime minister david cameron , in an interview with nbc news , said this is not a fight we can opt out of .
cameron was expected to seek parliamentary approval to engage .
the us warned syria the strikes were coming but we did not coordinate our actions with the syrian government , the state department said .
iranian president rouhani said the strikes amounted to an attack because they were not approved by the un or syria , the wall street journal reported .
the pentagon said coalition partners participated in combat air patrols and actual strikes on targets , although no numbers were disclosed .
the pentagon admitted the vast majority of the strikes were carried out by the united states .
the math supports that , a spokesman said .

documents.title: cameron : 'this is not a fight we can opt out of '
text: nbc has aired a clip of an interview to be aired in full tonight in the network 's primetime broadcast with british prime minister david cameron , talking about the us-led air strikes in syria .
the united kingdom was not mentioned in the coalition us president barack obama described tuesday morning .
cameron is expected possibly to return to london from the united nations later this week to seek a parliamentary imprimatur for joining the coalition .
this is not a fight we can opt out of , cameron says .
he says there is a threat of attacks in europe akin to the murders in may at the jewish museum in brussels .
the syrian observatory for human rights has reported that eight civilians were killed in strikes around aleppo and idlib , west of raqqa .
the us defense department says it is not aware of any civilian casualties .
u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) ltg mayville re # syria : we are unaware of any civilian casualties .
limiting civilian casualties is a top priority of the u.s .
the pentagon is tweeting before-and-after displayed by mayville during his briefing .
mayville displayed three .

here 's one , which he described as showing the destruction of a communications facility atop a building : u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) image of before and after photos of the finance center hit with tomahawk missile .

us president barack obama and first lady michelle obama walk to board marine one after the president delivered remarks on airstrikes against islamic state ( is ) targets in syria , on the south lawn of the white house in washington , dc , usa 23 september 2014 .
thew/epa
mayville again is asked how many of these strikes were american : the preponderance of force came from us platforms , he says , but he wo n't give number .
we used different types of munitions , he says .
he 's asked , is it fair to say that the vast majority of the strikes were carried out by american assets ?
the math supports that , he says .
mayville is asked about isil blending in with the syrian population .
will air strikes become more difficult ?
in his answer mayville refers to joint terminal attack controllers , ground forces to help guide air strikes : we have seen evidence that they 're already doing that .
there are other ways to deliver precise munitions than putting a j-tac forward .
it obviously is something we prefer to do in an urban environment there 's obviously a desire to put something on the ground .
but we do n't always have to strikes with jtacs forward .
mayville declines to say what percentage of the strikes were carried out by us partners .

he says they 're not sure how isis is reacting : it 's too early to characterize precisely what isil has done in response to last night 's attacks they will adapt to what we 've done and seek to address their shortfalls and gaps against out air strikes in the coming weeks .
the most important thing is to create some space for the iraqi security forces to reorganize , he says .
and to allow them to get on the offensive .
what last night 's campaign was about was simply buying them some space so that they can get on the offensive .
mayville is asked whether the strikes did not benefit assad .
right now the task at hand is countering isil , that 's job one .
we did several strikes in support of peshmerga forces in iraq .
i would n't characterize the effects we had last night as benefitting assad , he says .
isil now knows there now is an air war against them .
mayville wo n't say whether syria turned its radar off to allow us planes entry .
the target acquisition radar acquisition i would characterize as passive , he says .
mayville says training and arming the syrian opposition will take years .
he 's asked about the imminent threat posed by khorasan and whether that threat has now gone away ?
give us some time to assess these targets , he says .
mayville is asked if he needs ground troops .
i think we 're appropriately sized for the task that we 've been given , mayville says .
we did not target individual leaders , mayville says .
we did however target command-and-control nodes .
we 've been watching this group for a long time , mayville says of khorasan .
we believe the khorasan group was nearing the execution phase in an attack either in northern europe , or the homeland , he says .
he says the group is clearly not focussed either on the assad regime or a group in syria , but is using syria as a safe haven .
he 's asked if the strikes did what the coalition wanted .
it would be premature to comment on the effects we need to do more study .
the offensive used multiple aircraft and cruise missiles from several countries .
these strikes were successful with minimal collateral damage , he says .
he says last night was just the beginning of a credible and sustainable , persistent campaign to degrade and ultimately destroy isil .
mayville describes the strikes in three waves .
the khorasan group was in the final stages of plans to carry out attacks against western targets and potentially against the us homeland , he says .
paraphrasing mayville : the strikes came in three waves .
the first wave was more than 40 tomahawk cruise missiles into eastern and northern syria , the majority against khorasan group .
then f-22 raptors , f-15 strike eagles and other launched from bases in the region against targets in northern syria .
against isil headquarters and camps .
then f-18s launched from uss george h w bush in the northern arabian gulf , and from elsewhere , attacked isil camps and combat vehicles principally in far eastern syria .
coalition partners participated in the second and third waves , mayville says .
the participation was combat air patrols and actual strikes on targets .
the prepondreance was in third wave .
98 % was precision-guided munitions , he says .

documents.title: kirby : 'last night 's strikes were only the beginning '
text: our initial indication is that these strikes were very successful , kirby says .
i can tell you that last night 's strikes were only the beginning .

documents.title: kirby : 'we do not coordinate with the assad regime '
text: rear admiral john kirby , the pentagon spokesman , is speaking first .
we do not coordinate with the assad regime , he says .
although we did inform their un ambassador , there was no coordination .
lieutenant general william mayville is about to conduct a briefing on u.s. military operations in syria at the pentagon .
those with us cable subscriptions can watch on c-span here .
the pentagon channel has a streaming channel , although it 's unclear whether they will broadcast the briefing .

voices from raqqa the guardian 's martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) has spoken by telephone with multiple civilians inside raqqa , the northern syrian city which has been a center for isis activities and which was a focal point of american and coalition strikes .
we in raqqa are split in our opinions about the air strikes , yasir , 25 , tells martin .

we felt that the air strikes are n't against isis but against other groups : the air strikes attacked the governorate building , tabaqa airport , brigade 93 in ain eissa and the headquarters of the raqqa tv station .
the streets are empty now and the city is deserted , and most people are hiding in their homes .
the air strikes happened at sunrise today , and we initially thought they were asaad strikes .
we were n't afraid anymore we are used to air strikes now .
i 've heard that 30 isis fighters were killed to be honest , this is what i 've heard from my neighbours .
i have n't left home at all .
we in raqqa are split in our opinions about the air strikes .
many of us were upset as we heard today that idlib was attacked and some headquarters of jabhat al-nusra and ahrar al-sham were attacked .
we felt that the air strikes are n't against isis but against other groups .
in the beginning , i was excited about the air strikes but now i fear these attacks and the motivations behind them .

voices from raqqa the guardian 's martin chulov ( @ martinchulov ) has spoken by telephone with multiple civilians inside raqqa , the northern syrian city which has been a center for isis activities and which was a focal point of american and coalition strikes .
reem , 20 , a university student , spent tuesday sheltering at home with her four younger sisters and parents , she tells martin : my mum does n't want us to leave .
she says we will stay home like the rest of the people in the city .
we have nowhere else to go .
my little sisters kept crying when they heard the bombing yesterday and they are still panicking .
there are very few shelters in the city and all we can do is hide on the ground floor of our home and gather together in one room .
i do n't know any of civilians being killed .
isis is quiet now and they have n't made any speeches yet .
yesterday when the air strikes happened , the electricity was cut for an hour and a half .
today , it is rather quiet but the market is now open again and i see people in the streets .
i believe the air strikes will bring some good results .
even if they manage to damage isis a little bit , i am with them .
we are fed up with isis and the air strikes are much better than the assad attacks on raqqa .
assad does n't attack isis , he attacks us .
we want to get rid of isis even if that means we will lose some of our people .
this is the price we have to pay to have our freedom back .

documents.title: obama statement transcript
text: good morning everybody .
last night on my orders , america 's armed forces began strikes against isil targets in syria .

today , the american people will give thanks for the extraordinary service of our men and women in uniform , including the pilots who flew these missions with the courage and professionalism that we 've come to expect from the finest military that the world 's ever known .
earlier this month i outlined for the american people our strategy , to confront the threat posed by the terrorist group known as isil .
i made clear that as part of this campaign , the united states would take action against targets in both iraq and syria , so that these terrorists ca n't find safe haven anywhere .
i also made clear that america would act as part of a broad coalition , and that 's exactly what we 've done .
we were joined in this action by our friends and partners .
saudia arabia , the united arab emirates , jordan , bahrain , and qatar .
america is proud to stand shoulder-to-shoulder with these nations on behalf of our common security .
the strength of this coalition makes it clear to the world that this is not america 's fight alone .
above all , the people and governments of the middle east are rejecting isil , and standing up for the peace and security that the people of the region and the world deserve .

meanwhile , we will move forward with our plan supported by bipartisan majorities in congress , to ramp up our effort to train and equip the syrian opposition , who are the best counterweight to isil and the assad regime .
and more broadly , more than 40 nations have offered to help , in this comprehensive effort to confront this terrorist threat .

to take out terrorist targets , to train and equip iraqi and syrian opposition fighters who are going up against isil on the ground , to cut off isil 's financing , to counter its hateful ideology , and to stop the flow of fighters into and out of the region .
last night we also took strikes to disrupt plotting against the united states and our allies by seasoned al-qaeda operatives in syria who are known as the khorasan group .

and once again it must be clear to anyone who would plot against america and try to do americans harm that we will not tolerate safe havens for terrorists who threaten our people i 've spoken to leaders in congress and i 'm pleased that there is bipartisan support for the actions that we 're taking .
america is always stronger when we stand united , and that unity sends a powerful message to the world that we will do what 's necessary to defend our country .

over the next several days , i will have the opportunity to meet with prime minister abadi of iraq , and with friends and allies at the united nations to continue building support for the coalition that is confronting this serious threat to our peace and security .
the overall effort will take time .
there will be challenges ahead .
but we 're going to do what 's necessary to take the fight to this terrorist group .
for the security of the country , and the region , and for the entire world .
thanks , god bless our troops , god bless america .

documents.title: obama : 'this is not america 's fight alone '
text: we 'll have a full transcript of the president 's remarks shortly .
he said the strikes had been carried out by a coalition including saudi arabia , the united arab emirates , jordan , bahrain and qatar .
the strength of this coalition makes it clear to the world that this is not america 's fight alone , he said .
the president did not mention the number of strikes or say whether they would continue in coming days .
obama speaks .
last night on my orders the us military carried out strikes against isil targets in syria , he says .
later he mentions strikes against the khorasan group , saying the us took strikes to disrupt plotting by them .
here 's a youtube feed of the statement president obama is about to deliver on syria :

the us warning syria before the air strikes does not count as military coordination , the us state department claims , as guardian washington correspondent paul lewis ( @ paullewis ) reports : the us state department confirmed its ambassador to the un , samantha power , gave her syrian counterpart an advance indication of likely military attacks against isis in the country - but strongly denied any military coordination .
we warned syria not to engage us aircraft , said jen psaki , the state department 's spokeswoman , in a statement .
we did not request the regime 's permission .
we did not coordinate our actions with the syrian government .
we did not provide advance notification to the syrians at a military level , or give any indication of our timing on specific targets .

documents.title: iran critical of us-led air strikes
text: iran has questioned the legality of the us led air strikes against isis in syria .
the wall street journal quoted president hassan rouhani as saying that the strikes amounted to an attack because they were not approved by the un or syria .
the us state department has confirmed that it informed syria about the attacks , but did not seek syria 's permission .

spokeswoman jen psaki said : the president made clear in his speech to the nation on september 10 that the united states would not hesitate to take direct action against isil and terrorists inside syria who were threatening the united states .

since that speech , we informed the syrian regime directly of our intent to take action through our ambassador to the united nations ( ambassador power ) to the syrian permanent representative to the united nations .
we warned syria not to engage us aircraft .
we did not request the regime 's permission .
we did not coordinate our actions with the syrian government .
we did not provide advance notification to the syrians at a military level , or give any indication of our timing on specific targets .
secretary kerry did not send a letter to the syrian regime .

documents.title: summary
text: here 's a summary of today 's main developments : the us and its arab allies have launched a major aerial bombing campaign against islamic state ( isis ) militants in syria .
the attacks , the first on syria soil , included military contributions from saudi arabia , bahrain , qatar , the uae and jordan .
general martin dempsey , chairman of the joint chiefs of staff , said the attacks had succeeded in demonstrating that there was no safe haven for isis .
he added : we now have a kind of credible campaign against isil that includes a coalition of partners .
separate us air strikes west of aleppo also targeted the al-qaida-linked khorasan group , with the aim of preventing an imminent attack against us and western interests .
the group has been fighting alongside militants from al-nusra front , which rivals islamic state .
the us said khorasan 's training camps and command centres were hit in eight strikes .
at least eight civilians have been killed in the us-led strikes , as well as scores of militants , according to a monitoring group .
video footage from idlib province showed several houses destroyed in a village .
the syrian observatory for human rights said at leasts 70 fighters from islamic state were killed and a further 50 from the al-nusra front died .
israel has announced that it shot down a syrian aircraft that flew into israeli-controlled airspace .
syrian accused israel of violating a un agreement and said it was using the us-led campaign against isis as a pretext for the aggression .
two pilots were filmed parachuting from the downed jet .

downing street has expressed support for the us-led air strikes as britain 's main political parties moved towards an agreement to recall parliament on friday to allow mps to approve british involvement in air strikes against isis forces .

david cameron who will attend a meeting of the un security council in new york chaired by barack obama on wednesday believes it would be politically impossible for him to proceed without the support of the opposition labour party .
syria 's main international ally , russia , condemned the strikes as a violation of syria 's sovereignty .
russia 's foreign ministry said : attempts to pursue own geopolitical goals through violating the sovereignty of other states only escalates tensions and aggravates the situation even further .
syria 's foreign ministry says the us informed damascus 's envoy to the united nations before launching the strikes .

syrian state media carried a brief statement from the foreign ministry , saying that the american side informed syria 's permanent envoy to the un that strikes will be launched against the daesh terrorist organisation [ islamic state ] in raqqa .
a moderate syrian opposition group said the strikes were necessary but not sufficient to defeat extremism .

hadi al-bahra , president of the syrian opposition coalition , said : we have called for air strikes such as those that commenced tonight with a heavy heart and deep concern , as these strikes begin in our own homeland .
we insist that utmost care is taken to avoid civilian casualties .
our people have been suffering at the hands of isis for over a year .

david cameron is to hold the first bilateral talks between a british prime minister and an iranian president since the 1979 revolution when he has a face to face meeting with hassan rouhani in the next two days in new york .
the meeting is designed to explore the support the iranians can give to the fight against isis in iraq and syria .
a new propaganda video featuring the british hostage john cantlie has been posted online by isis within hours of the launch of us-led air strikes against the group in syria .
appearing once again behind a desk and reading calmly from a script , cantlie used the latest in what he says will be a series of programmes to condemn the military build-up in the region .
a splinter group that claims links to isis released a video on monday night of a french tourist abducted on sunday while on holiday in algeria .
the group has threatened to execute him unless france halts air strikes on isis positions in iraq .
the french foreign ministry confirmed the authenticity of the video and identified the hostage as 55-year-old hervã© gourdel .
a coalition of human rights and humanitarian groups have called on all sides in the conflict in syria to protect civilians .

the withsyria coalition , which includes save the children and amnesty international is urging world leaders , whoever they support in the conflict , to make clear that they are on the side of civilians .

britain 's former foreign secretary david miliband , president of international rescue committee one of the signatories , said : we need world leaders this week to work together to end attacks on civilians and ensure people get the aid they need .
the world must not turn its back on the people of syria who have been attacked both indiscriminately and directly for more than three years .
caught up in a conflict not of their making , syrians are dying every day .
as humanitarian agencies our mandate is to help them , but there are people we ca n't reach because of the continuing attacks by all sides that also put our staff at risk .
at least 120 militants have been killed in the us led air strikes in syria , according to the british-based syrian observatory for human rights .
it said 70 of those killed were from the islamic state group .
the other 50 casualties were from al-nusra front , it said .
it also said the number of those killed from the islamic state is likely to increase to more than 150 , as 100 critically injured fighters were taken to iraq for treatment .
the observatory still puts the number of civilian casualties at eight people , including three children .
more footage has emerged purporting to show air strikes on the eastern syrian town of abu kamal .
syrian citizens checking the damage in the village of kfar derian /ap

syrians check a damaged house targeted by the air strikes in the village of kfar derian , a base for the al-qaida-linked nusra front , a rival of the islamic state group , between the northern province of aleppo and idlib .
news network/ap
in a few hours barack obama will make a statement on the us-led strikes against isis in syria , the white house has announced .
the us president will speak at the white house before departing at 10.20am edt ( 1420 gmt ) .
the us department of defence 's joint staff director of operations will also will hold a press briefing on the operations in syria at 11am edt ( 1500 gmt ) .
downing street has expressed support for the us-led air strikes , pa reports .

david cameron will use talks at the united nations general assembly in new york over the next two days - including with the president of iran - to discuss what contribution the uk and other members of the international community can make to the fight against the terror group .

it said : the pm will be holding talks at the united nations in new york over the next two days on what more the uk and others can do to contribute to international efforts to tackle the threat we all face from isil .
the uk is already offering significant military support , including supplying arms to the kurds as well as surveillance operations by a squadron of tornadoes and other raf aircraft .
the prime minister , who is in new york for the meeting of the united nations general assembly , is expected to use a speech tomorrow to set out further details of britain 's contribution .

there is growing speculation that he will announce that uk forces will join the air strikes - although they are thought likely to be restricted to iraq - where they would be operating at the invitation of the government in baghdad .

an anti-militant media group called raqqa is being silently slaughtered ' said that targets in the city included the governorate building or municipality used by islamic state militants as their headquarters , and the brigade 93 , a syrian army base that the militants recently seized .
the headquarters building is shown on this satellite view .
isis targets in raqa

the launch of the us-led air strikes has achieved the strategic aim of showing the extremists that their attacks will not go unanswered , according to american most senior military officer , ap reports .

we wanted to make sure that isil knew they have no safe haven , and we certainly achieved that , army gen. martin dempsey , chairman of the joint chiefs of staff , said in an interview with a small group of reporters as he flew to washington after a weeklong trip to europe .
us officials said five arab nations either participated in the airstrikes or provided unspecified support .
they were saudi arabia , qatar , bahrain , jordan and the united arab emirates .
dempsey said their role was indispensable to the us goal of showing that the battle to degrade and defeat the islamic state group is not just a us fight .
i ca n't overstate the importance of the arab role , he said .
he called it an unprecedented coalition with arab states and said the partnering has set the stage for a broader international campaign against the extremists .

dempsey said the five arab nations ' agreement to join in the air strikes came together quickly ; as recently as sunday he told reporters that more arab participation was needed before president barack obama would sign off on the strategic air campaign .
once we had one of them on board , the others followed quickly thereafter , he said , adding that the partnership came together over the past three days .
we now have a kind of credible campaign against isil that includes a coalition of partners .
army general martin dempsey , chairman of the joint chiefs of staff .
scott applewhite/ap
the prospects for success of the new us-led campaign in syria remain very uncertain , according to julien barnes-dacey middle east analyst with the european council on foreign relations .

the respective positioning of non-is rebels and assad highlights an inconvenient truth : as long as syria 's civil war rages , international attempts to defeat islamic state militarily will be significantly hampered , particularly if regional allies are also pulling in different directions .
while tactical lines may shift as a result of air strikes , they are unlikely to provoke significant strategic realignments .
given their likely inconclusive nature , they risk drawing the west into deeper intervention .

while obama has clearly stated that us intervention in syria will remain limited , those calling for wider action may see the proposed initial strikes and arming of rebels as the thin edge of the wedge , with further escalation inevitable .

significantly , narrow air strikes that inflict collateral damage and leave the regime unscathed also risk further empowering isis , consolidating its self-declared position as the only legitimate defender of syria 's sunni population .

isis 's apparent goading of the us to intervene in syria and iraq through the public beheading of a number of hostages may appear misguided given the power that the american military can bring to bear .
but blunt military intervention may help entrench local support behind the group .
britain 's former middle east minister , alistair burt , has described the co-ordinated air strikes by the us and five arab allies as a turning point .
he also backed a recall of parliament to discuss britain joining the operation .
alistair burt ( @ alistairburtmp ) turning point in me as regional states lead against is .
chance of new drive for wider peace in syria should also be taken .
# recall please
peter beaumont in jerusalem has more on the downing of that syrian jet by an israeli patriot missile battery .

video footage of the first such downing by israel of a syrian jet since 1982 , showed two burning sections of the plane falling to the ground and then the parachutes of the pilot and navigator who ejected moments before the impact .

syria immediately condemned the downing of the jet with state television describing it as an act of aggression and linking it to us-led air strikes against islamic state in syria that had occurred earlier .
the jet entered israeli controlled air space a few minutes before 9 o'clock in the morning and was flying at between 10,000 and 14,000 feet when it was engaged .

commenting on the incident , which occurred early on tuesday morning , an israeli military source said that a syrian aircraft infiltrated into israeli air space [ and had been ] intercepted in mid-flight , using the patriot air defence system .

military sources and experts described the plane as a sukhoi 24 which they say had flown from saikal air base in eastern syria , adding that they believe it had strayed into israeli air space while fully armed on a mission to bomb anti-government groups on the other side of the border .
the syrian observatory for human rights said the warplane had been bombing areas outside quneitra , a syrian town near the israeli-held side of the frontier , at the time it was shot down .
the decision to down the aircraft was taken after it had spent 1 minute and 20 seconds in israeli airspace .
defending the decision to engage the aircraft , sources and military experts said the interception of israel by an armed enemy aircraft could not be tolerated .

commenting on the incident , defence minister moshe ya'alon , said that the syrian warplane had approached israeli territory in the golan heights in a threatening manner , and even crossed the border .

he added that israel has made it clear in the past , and is reiterating now : we will not allow anyone , neither state nor terror organization to threaten our security and to violate our sovereignty .
in recent weeks fighting on the golan heights , which israel captured from syria during the six day war in 1967 , has heightened tensions on a border that has long been quiet .
the assad regime has recently been fighting al-qaida linked groups in the area of the quneitra border crossing .
on a visit to the golan last week the guardian could hear the sound of fighting echoing over the mountainous border throughout the day and into the night .
israel has largely stayed on the sidelines of syria 's civil war raging across the border .
but israeli leaders appear increasingly nervous about the possibility of al-qaida-linked fighters occupying the golan 's high ground over northern israel .
israeli troops have responded to occasional mortar fire that has landed on the israeli side of the golan .
israel says some of the attacks have been accidental spillover , while others have been intentionally aimed at israeli civilians and soldiers .
it has always held syria responsible for any cross-border fire .

despite the incident the former israeli air force commander eitan ben eliyahu said he did not believe that the assad regime was trying to provoke an escalation adding that he did not believe the aircraft posed a threat to israel when it was shot down .
speaking on israel radio he said : the syrian regime would not dare nowand it has not dared for decadesto do anything to provoke us .
so i do n't believe that this was deliberate .
the fighting there is right on the border fence and when planes are involved , because of their speed and altitude and ability to spot the targets , it is easy to make mistakes .
we , of course , can not permit this .
no , i do n't consider the infiltration as a threat .
but it reminds us of the mess over there .
perhaps the most important thing is the formation of the coalition against isis .
islamic state fighters have posted video footage of the wreckage of a us drone they said crashed into communications tower in raqqa .
fighters from the islamic state group gesture as they load a van with parts that they said was a us drone that crashed into a communications tower in raqqa early on tuesday .
/afp/getty images
at least three dutch jihadis fighting with the al-nusra front , have been killed in the us-led raids , according to the belgium-based analyst pieter van ostaeyen .

pieter van ostaeyen ( @ p vanostaeyen ) correction : 3 dutch killed , no belgians # syria in its latest update the british-based syrian observatory for human rights said at least 50 fighters from al-nusra were killed .
the vast majority were non-syrian , it said .
it confirmed that civilians were killed in the bombing in the idlib village of kafr derian , west of aleppo .
they included three children , it said .
video from the village shows residents search through the blood-stained rubble of houses said to have been destroyed in the attack .

the us navy has released more footage of tomahawk missiles being launched against isis in syria from a ship in the red sea - this time the uss philippine sea , part of the uss george hw bush carrier strike group .

documents.title: russia condemns us-led air strikes
text: russia has condemned the us-led strikes on isis in syria as a violation of syria 's sovereignty .

ria novosti quotes russia 's foreign ministry as saying : attempts to pursue own geopolitical goals through violating the sovereignty of other states only escalates tensions and aggravates the situation even further .
moscow has repeatedly warned that those who initiated one-sided military scenarios bear full international legal responsibility for the consequences .
the us navy has released video footage of tomahawk missiles being fired against isis targets in syria from the uss arleigh burke .
a former senior israeli general has explained why israel shot down a syrian jet .

reserve brigadier general ram shmueli , former head of israeli airforce intelligence and former fighter pilot , said : [ it was an ] su 24 with armament and we believe its mission was to attack some enemy forces - not us but isis or some other group in the syrian golan heights .
unfortunately [ it ] crossed the border and we can not tolerate any penetration of the israeli air space , so we had to shoot [ it ] down .
although we believe [ its ] intention was not to attack us when there is a jet fully loaded with ammunition he can drop that ammunition on israel , so ca n't take any chance .
we intercepted immediately and the pilot ejected with the remains of aircraft landing on syrian side .

documents.title: summary
text: here 's a summary of today 's main developments so far : the us and its arab allies have launched a major aerial bombing campaign against islamic state ( isis ) militants in syria .
the attacks , the first on syria soil , included military contributions from saudi arabia , bahrain , qatar , the uae and jordan .
separate us air strikes west of aleppo also targeted the al-qaida-linked khorasan group , with the aim of preventing an imminent attack against us and western interests .
the group has been fighting alongside militants from al-nusra front , which rivals islamic state .
the us said khorasan 's training camps and command centres were hit in eight strikes .
at least eight civilians have been killed in the us-led strikes , as well as scores of militants , according to a monitoring group .
video footage from idlib province showed several houses destroyed in a village .
israel has announced that it shot down a syrian aircraft that flew into israeli-controlled airspace .
syrian accused israel of violating a un agreement and said it was using the us-led campaign against isis as a pretext for the aggression .
two pilots were filmed parachuting from the downed jet .
britain 's main political parties are moving towards an agreement to recall parliament on friday to allow mps to approve british involvement in air strikes against isis forces .

david cameron who will attend a meeting of the un security council in new york chaired by barack obama on wednesday believes it would be politically impossible for him to proceed without the support of the opposition labour party .
syria 's foreign ministry says the us informed damascus 's envoy to the united nations before launching the strikes .

syrian state media carried a brief statement from the foreign ministry , saying that the american side informed syria 's permanent envoy to the un that strikes will be launched against the daesh terrorist organisation [ islamic state ] in raqqa .
a moderate syrian opposition group said the strikes were necessary but not sufficient to defeat extremism .

hadi al-bahra , president of the syrian opposition coalition , said : we have called for air strikes such as those that commenced tonight with a heavy heart and deep concern , as these strikes begin in our own homeland .
we insist that utmost care is taken to avoid civilian casualties .
our people have been suffering at the hands of isis for over a year .

david cameron is to hold the first bilateral talks between a british prime minister and an iranian president since the 1979 revolution when he has a face to face meeting with hassan rouhani in the next two days in new york .
the meeting is designed to explore the support the iranians can give to the fight against isis in iraq and syria .
a new propaganda video featuring the british hostage john cantlie has been posted online by isis within hours of the launch of us-led air strikes against the group in syria .
appearing once again behind a desk and reading calmly from a script , cantlie used the latest in what he says will be a series of programmes to condemn the military build-up in the region .
a splinter group that claims links to isis released a video on monday night of a french tourist abducted on sunday while on holiday in algeria .
the group has threatened to execute him unless france halts air strikes on isis positions in iraq .
the french foreign ministry confirmed the authenticity of the video and identified the hostage as 55-year-old hervã© gourdel .

the locations of today 's main developments , including us strikes against khorasan militants in syria , as well as islamic state fighters ; and the shooting down of a syrian jet by israel , are pinpointed on this map .
haaretz has more detail on the downing of the syrian jet .

just before the us-led strikes were launched , syria 's foreign minister , walid al-moallem , warned against the clandestine aims of the us and its allies who he said had been supporting the very terrorists they are now targeting .

in an interview with the russian-funded channel rt , moallem , who is also syria 's deputy prime minister , said : we must distinguish between the international efforts in the framework of the security council 's resolution no .

2170 to combat the terrorism of the isis , jabhat al-nusra and other al-qaida-linked terrorist organizations , and the hidden intentions of the us and its allies as the members of this alliance are the same countries which have conspired against syria for more than three years .
eight civilians and seven members of the al-nusra fronts were among those killed by the coordinated us-led strikes , according to the british based syrian observatory for human rights .
two syrian pilots were filmed parachuting from that jet after it was shot by an israeli missile over the golan heights , according to unverified amateur footage .
here 's a more detailed map showing the areas hit in coordinated raids against islamic state in syria .

documents.title: syria condemns israeli attack on jet
text: syria has condemned an israeli attack on one of its jets as a clear violation of a un security council resolution .
syrian state media suggested the downing of the syrian jet , confirmed by israel , was conducted under the pretext of the us-led operation against militants in syria .
amateur footage captured the moment the syrian jet was shot down over the golan heights .
video from a village in the northern syrian province of idlib purports to show the remains of several buildings destroyed in the us-led air raids .
the us attacks on raqqa were witnessed by twitter user , abdulkader hariri , buzz feed reports .
abdulkader hariri ( @ 3bdulkaed6r ) the sky is full drones over raqqa now abdulkader hariri ( @ 3bdulkaed6r ) the airstrikes 5/6 concentrated near the 'governorate building ' isis 's main hq .
meanwhile , sounds of warplanes can be heard clearly
video in syrian has emerged purporting to show the remains of us cruise missile involved in one of tuesday 's raids .
in the clip a serial number from the wreckage is filmed .
what is the khorasan group ?
the international business times have an explainer after the syria-based group threatened a terror attack on the us .

led by muhsin al-fadhli , who was thought to have a very close relationship with osama bin laden , khorasan is one of al qaeda 's affiliates in syria and possibly one of the most secretive groups operating under the cover of syria 's civil war .
unlike many of the other groups in syria who seek to overthrow syrian president bashar assad , isis or both , khorasan has expressed little interest in the war 's outcome .
most notably , the group has ties to notorious yemeni bomb maker ibrahim al-asiri , who is part of al qaeda 's branch there , al qaeda in the arabian peninsula .
asiri is believed to be responsible for making the underwear bomb used by umar farouk abdulmutallab in 2009 , the associated press reported .
the group is believed to be working alongside the al-nusra front , which the syrian observatory for human rights said was also targeted in tuesday 's raids .

documents.title: separate militant group hit in raids
text: the us military also targeted another militant outfit - the khorasan group in the syrian air strikes .
it said the group is linked to al-qaida and was planning an imminent attack on the us .

separately , the united states has also taken action to disrupt the imminent attack plotting against the united states and western interests conducted by a network of seasoned al-qa'ida veterans - sometimes referred to as the khorasan group - who have established a safe haven in syria to develop external attacks , construct and test improvised explosive devices and recruit westerners to conduct operations .
these strikes were undertaken only by us assets .

in total , u.s. central command conducted eight strikes against khorasan group targets west of aleppo to include training camps , an explosives and munitions production facility , a communication building and command and control facilities .
the syrian observatory for human rights claimed that a third group , the al-nusra front , was also hit .
this has not been confirmed by the us .
the pentagon has confirmed the sweeping scale of the bombardment against isis targets in syria and the international partners involved .

in a statement it said : us military forces and partner nations , including the kingdom of bahrain , the hashemite kingdom of jordan , the kingdom of saudi arabia , qatar and the united arab emirates , undertook military action against isil terrorists in syria overnight , using a mix of fighter , bomber , remotely piloted aircraft and tomahawk land attack missiles to conduct 14 strikes against isil targets .

the strikes destroyed or damaged multiple isil targets in the vicinity of ar raqqah , dayr az zawr , al hasakah , and abu kamal and included isil fighters , training compounds , headquarters and command and control facilities , storage facilities , a finance center , supply trucks and armed vehicles .

to conduct these strikes , the united states employed 47 tlams launched from uss arleigh burke and uss philippine sea operating from international waters in the red sea and north arabian gulf , as well as us air force , navy and marine corps fighter , remotely piloted and bomber aircraft deployed to the u.s. central command area of operations .

in addition , the kingdom of bahrain , the hashemite kingdom of jordan , the kingdom of saudi arabia , qatar and the united arab emirates also participated in or supported the airstrikes against isil targets .
all aircraft safely exited the strike areas the united states conducted these strikes as part of the president 's comprehensive strategy to degrade and ultimately defeat isil .
going forward , the u.s. military will continue to conduct targeted airstrikes against isil in syria and iraq as local forces go on the offensive against this terrorist group .
the new us-led bombardment against isis in syria is a much larger operation than the campaign in iraq , according to the new york times .

it describes it as a torrent of cruise missiles and precision-guided bombs from the air and sea american fighter jets and armed predator and reaper drones , flying alongside warplanes from several arab allies , struck a broad array of targets in territory controlled by the militants , known as the islamic state .
american defence officials said the targets included weapons supplies , depots , barracks and buildings the militants use for command and control .
tomahawk cruise missiles were fired from united states navy ships in the region .
the strikes are a major turning point in president obama 's war against the islamic state and open up a risky new stage of the american military campaign .

until now , the administration had bombed islamic state targets only in iraq , and had suggested it would be weeks if not months before the start of a bombing campaign against islamic state targets in syria .

unlike american strikes in iraq over the past month , which have been small-bore bombings of mostly individual islamic state targets patrol boats and trucks the salvo on tuesday in syria was the beginning of what was expected to be a sustained , hourslong bombardment at targets in the militant headquarters in raqqa and on the border .
syrian state media has confirmed that damascus was informed before the us strikes were launched .
it said the strikes hit the isis stronghold of raqqa late on monday .

meanwhile , the jordanian army said it had mounted air strikes against terrorist groups that were planning attacks in jordan , an indication amman had joined us-led air strikes against islamic state in neighbouring syria .
a jordanian army statement did not say where the air force had struck .
air force jets destroyed a number of targets that belong to some terrorist groups that sought to commit terror acts inside jordan , the statement broadcast on state tv said , reuters reports .

documents.title: israel shoots down syrian aircraft
text: israel has announced that it shot down a syrian aircraft that flew into israeli-controlled airspace .
moments ago a syrian aircraft infiltrated israeli airspace .
the idf ( israel defense forces ) intercepted the aircraft in mid-flight , using the patriot air defence system .
the circumstances of the incident are being reviewed , a military statement said .
israel radio said the aircraft was a drone and was shot down over the israeli-occupied golan heights , where fighting from syria 's civil war has occasionally spilled over .
israeli army radio said it may have been a syrian warplane .
idf ( @ idfspokesperson ) moment ago , a syrian aircraft infiltrated israeli airspace .
idf 's patriot air defense system intercepted the aircraft .

documents.title: britain not involved in air strikes
text: britain said that no final decision had been made over whether to join air strikes launched by the united states and several gulf arab allies on islamic state strongholds in syria .
a spokeswoman at the ministry of defence said discussions were still ongoing , reuters reports .
the office of british prime minister david cameron said britain was not currently part of the action against islamic state militants who have seized large expanses of territory in iraq and syria .
a recent poll by yougov found that public opinion in britain has shifted on the issue .
it showed a majority would back the raf joining us strikes against isis in syria .
yougov ( @ yougov ) a majority of the british public now support raf strikes on is in syria : our @ twitterid poll
at least 50 air strikes have been launched against militants in syria , according to the british-based monitoring group the syrian observatory for human rights .
they included strikes against militants from the al-qaida linked al-nusra front , a rival group to isis , the observatory reported .
targets hit included isis headquarters in the eastern syrian town of abu kamal and training camps in the province of deir al-zor .
rami abdulrahman , who runs the syrian observatory for human rights , said at least 20 islamic state fighters were killed in the air strikes .
he also said nusra front positions had been struck in the provinces of idlib and aleppo in northwest syria .
welcome to live coverage of us-led battle against islamic state militants in iraq and now syria .
here 's a roundup of what 's happened .
the united states stepped up its war against the islamic state militant group , launching air strikes on targets in syria for the first time .

a us official , speaking on condition of anonymity , indicated that raqqa , a syrian stronghold of isis , was among the targets of the operation , which began in the early hours of tuesday morning and continues .
the us was joined in the syria operation by bahrain , qatar , saudi arabia , jordan and the united arab emirates , an official said .
the strikes were carried out by manned air force and navy aircraft , while the tomahawk missiles were launched from us ships in the northern persian gulf and the red sea .
syria 's foreign ministry says the us 's informed damascus ' envoy to the united nations before launching the strikes .

syrian state media carried a brief statement from the foreign ministry , saying that the american side informed syria 's permanent envoy to the un that strikes will be launched against the daesh terrorist organization in raqqa .
a moderate syrian opposition group said the strikes were necessary but not sufficient to defeat extremism .

hadi al bahra , president of the syrian opposition coalition said : we have called for airstrikes such as those that commenced tonight with a heavy heart and deep concern , as these strikes begin in our own homeland .
we insist that utmost care is taken to avoid civilian casualties .
our people have been suffering at the hands of isis for over a year .

david cameron is to hold the first bilateral talks between a british prime minister and an iranian president since the 1979 revolution when he has a face to face meeting with president hassan rouhani in the next two days in new york .
the meeting is designed to explore the support the iranians can give to the fight against islamic state ( isis ) in iraq and syria .
a splinter group that claims links isis released a video on monday night of a french tourist abducted on sunday while on holiday in algeria .
the group has threatened to execute him unless france halts air strikes on isis positions in iraq .
the french foreign ministry confirmed the authenticity of the video and identified the hostage as 55-year-old hervã© gourdel .
